item.title: This week on Perl 6 ~(24-30 June 2002)
item.description: Processes, iterators, fun with the Perl 6 grammar and more...

item.title: Taglib TMTOWTDI
item.description: Continuing our look at AxKit tag libraries, Barrie explains the use of SimpleTaglib and LogicSheets.

item.title: Synopsis 5
item.description: Confused by the last Apocalypse? Allison Randal and Damian Conway explain the changes in a more succinct form.

item.title: Improving mod_perl Sites' Performance: Part 2
item.description: Before making any optimizations to mod_perl applications, it's important to know what you need to be optimizing. Benchmarks are key to this, and Stas Beckman introduces the important tools for mod_perl benchmarking.

item.title: Where Wizards Fear To Tread
item.description: One of the new features coming in Perl 5.8 will be reliable interpreter threading, thanks primarily to the work of Artur Bergman. In this article, he explains what you need to do to make your Perl modules thread-safe.

item.title: Apocalypse 5
item.description: In part 5 of his design for Perl 6, Larry takes a long hard look at regular expressions, and comes up with some interesting ideas...

item.title: Improving mod_perl Sites' Performance: Part 1
item.description: What do we need to think about when optimizing mod_perl applications? Stas Bekman explains how hardware, software and good programming come into play.

item.title: Achieving Closure
item.description: What's a closure, and why does everyone go on about them?

item.title: Finding a mod_perl ISP... or Becoming One
item.description: You're ready to use mod_perl -- but do you have a server to run it on? Stas Bekman explains what an ISP needs to do to run mod_perl programs, and how to find an ISP that lets you do so.

item.title: The Perl You Need To Know - Part 3
item.description: Stas Bekman finishes his introduction to the basic Perl skills you need to use mod_perl; this week, globals versus lexicals, modules and packages.

item.title: Where Wizards Fear To Tread
item.description: So you're a Perl master. You've got XS sorted. You know how the internals work. Hey, there's nothing we can teach you on perl.com that you don't already know. You think? Our new series teaches the topics others only dream about, starting with the Perl op tree.

item.title: The Perl You Need To Know - Part 2
item.description: Stas Bekman continues his mod_perl series by looking at the basic Perl skills you need to use mod_perl; this week, subroutines inside subroutines.

item.title: Becoming a CPAN Tester with CPANPLUS
item.description: A few weeks ago, Jos Broumans introduced CPANPLUS, his replacement for the CPAN module. In the time since then, development has continued apace, and today's release includes support for automatically testing and reporting bugs in CPAN modules. Autrijus Tang explains how it all works.

item.title: mod_perl Developer's Cookbook
item.description: Geoffrey Young, Paul Lindner and Randy Kobes have produced a new book on mod_perl which claims to teach "tricks, solutions and mod_perl idioms" - how well does it live up to this promise?

item.title: The Perl You Need To Know
item.description: This week, Stas Bekman goes back to basics to explain some Perl topics of interest to his continuing mod_perl series.
